nodes.text: The L-1g general purpose droid, also known as the L-1 general purpose droid, L-1 general service droid, or L-1g worker droid, was a model of service droid commonly used for basic operational tasks. The droid was equipped with an AA-1 VerboBrain processor on par with that of a high-end protocol droid and vertistile language processors. Due to its capacity to calculate complex scenarios, some referred to the model as the L-1 tactical droid. However, few bothered to use the L-1 unit to its full potential.

In the year 14 BBY, the Scrapper Guild used L-1g units painted in blue with red stripes as foremen on the planet Bracca. On the planet Corellia, in 13 BBY, units painted yellow with blue stripes were employed on shipyards for various menial tasks, including disassembling hydro transfer conduit to clear a minnow blockage. K-OHN was a L-1 tactical droid, as was SV-3.

The L-1g general purpose droid first appeared, albeit unidentified, in the 2016 film Rogue One: A Star Wars Story. While the 2016 reference book Star Wars: Rogue One: The Ultimate Visual Guide identified the model as the L-1 tactical droid, the 2018 reference book Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide identified it as the L-1g general purpose droid. The 2018 reference book Star Wars: Droidography clarified that while some referred to the L-1g as a tactical droid due to its capacity to calculate complex scenarios, it was actually a model of service droid.
